intro: Dyssodia oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca dyssodia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant features small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showing adaptability to arid conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
